snippet: The Afghan cabinet ministries that work most closely with Western countries are under intense pressure from Parliament and an anti-graft commission.
abstract: Omar Zakhilwal, Afghan finance minister, is being investigated in connection with corruption allegations, latest development in a widening shake-up in some of the Afghan government most powerful ministries; investigations are rooted in differing political tensions, but taken together, they raise the prospect that the West's already tenuous relationship with the Afghan government could become even less stable.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Afghan cabinet ministries that work most closely with Western countries are under intense pressure from Parliament and an anti-graft commission.

headline.seo: Key Afghan Agencies Under Growing Pressure
headline.main: Key Officials Under Karzai Are Criticized
headline.print_headline: Key Officials Under Karzai Are Criticized
